summary.para: The AddValue method records a new value.

param.name: lIndex
param.para: Specifies the index of the statistic.

param.name: dValue
param.para: Specifies the value to record.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The GetIndex method retrieves the index for a named statistic, or creates a new statistic.

param.name: szName
param.para: Specifies the name of the statistic.

param.name: lCreate
param.para: Specifies whether to create the statistic, if it is not defined already. If the value is TRUE, the method creates a new index for the statistic when it cannot find an existing entry with that name. If the value is FALSE, the method fails when the statistic does not already exist.

param.name: plIndex
param.para: Receives the index.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The GetValueByIndex method retrieves a statistic, by index.

param.name: lIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the statistic.

param.name: szName
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the name of the statistic.

param.name: lCount
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of values that were recorded.

param.name: dLast
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the most recent value that was recorded.

param.name: dAverage
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the average value.

param.name: dStdDev
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the standard deviation of the values. If the count is less than two, the standard deviation is zero.

param.name: dMin
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum value that was recorded.

param.name: dMax
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum value that was recorded.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

remarks.para: The caller must free the string returned in szName, by calling the SysFreeString function.
To get the number of statistics, call .

summary.para: The GetValueByName method retrieves a statistic, by name.

param.name: szName
param.para: Specifies the name of the statistic.

param.name: lIndex
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the index of this statistic.

param.name: lCount
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the number of values that were recorded.

param.name: dLast
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the most recent value that was recorded.

param.name: dAverage
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the average value.

param.name: dStdDev
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the standard deviation of the values. If the count is less than two, the standard deviation is zero.

param.name: dMin
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the minimum value that was recorded.

param.name: dMax
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the maximum value that was recorded.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The get_Count method retrieves the number of statistics.

param.name: plCount
param.para: Receives the number of statistics.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

summary.para: The Reset method resets all statistics to zero.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful, or an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: The IAMStats interface retrieves performance data from the Filter Graph Manager. Filters can use this interface to record performance data.
Filter developers: As with all Filter Graph Manager interfaces, a filter must not hold a reference count on this interface, or it will cause a circular reference count. For more information, see .

remarks.para: Each statistic is defined by a name and an index. Use the GetIndex method to find the index from the name. Values are always double types. The following statistics are predefined.

item.description: Measures the time taken by each call to .
Measures the time taken to connect two filters.
Measures the time taken to cache information about registered filters (used by the Filter Mapper object).
Measures the time taken to cache information about filters in a particular category, where CategoryName is the friendly name of the filter category. (See Filter Categories.)

remarks.para: For each of these statistics, the values represent time in milliseconds.
